speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: SCENE III. The same.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Enter BIRON, with a paper

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: The king he is hunting the deer; I am coursing

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: myself: they have pitched a toil; I am toiling in

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: a pitch,--pitch that defiles: defile! a foul

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: word. Well, set thee down, sorrow! for so they say

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: the fool said, and so say I, and I the fool: well

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: proved, wit! By the Lord, this love is as mad as

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Ajax: it kills sheep; it kills me, I a sheep:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: well proved again o' my side! I will not love: if

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I do, hang me; i' faith, I will not. O, but her

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: eye,--by this light, but for her eye, I would not

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: love her; yes, for her two eyes. Well, I do nothing

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: in the world but lie, and lie in my throat. By

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: heaven, I do love: and it hath taught me to rhyme

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: and to be melancholy; and here is part of my rhyme,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: and here my melancholy. Well, she hath one o' my

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: sonnets already: the clown bore it, the fool sent

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: it, and the lady hath it: sweet clown, sweeter

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: fool, sweetest lady! By the world, I would not care

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: a pin, if the other three were in. Here comes one

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: with a paper: God give him grace to groan!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Stands aside

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Enter FERDINAND, with a paper

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Ay me!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: [Aside]  Shot, by heaven! Proceed, sweet Cupid:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: thou hast thumped him with thy bird-bolt under the

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: left pap. In faith, secrets!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: [Reads]

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: So sweet a kiss the golden sun gives not

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: To those fresh morning drops upon the rose,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: As thy eye-beams, when their fresh rays have smote

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The night of dew that on my cheeks down flows:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Nor shines the silver moon one half so bright

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Through the transparent bosom of the deep,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: As doth thy face through tears of mine give light;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Thou shinest in every tear that I do weep:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: No drop but as a coach doth carry thee;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: So ridest thou triumphing in my woe.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Do but behold the tears that swell in me,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And they thy glory through my grief will show:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: But do not love thyself; then thou wilt keep

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: My tears for glasses, and still make me weep.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: O queen of queens! how far dost thou excel,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: No thought can think, nor tongue of mortal tell.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: How shall she know my griefs? I'll drop the paper:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Sweet leaves, shade folly. Who is he comes here?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Steps aside

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What, Longaville! and reading! listen, ear.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Now, in thy likeness, one more fool appear!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Enter LONGAVILLE, with a paper

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Ay me, I am forsworn!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Why, he comes in like a perjure, wearing papers.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: In love, I hope: sweet fellowship in shame!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: One drunkard loves another of the name.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Am I the first that have been perjured so?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I could put thee in comfort. Not by two that I know:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Thou makest the triumviry, the corner-cap of society,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: The shape of Love's Tyburn that hangs up simplicity.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: I fear these stubborn lines lack power to move:

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: O sweet Maria, empress of my love!

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: These numbers will I tear, and write in prose.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, rhymes are guards on wanton Cupid's hose:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Disfigure not his slop.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: This same shall go.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Reads

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Did not the heavenly rhetoric of thine eye,

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: 'Gainst whom the world cannot hold argument,

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Persuade my heart to this false perjury?

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Vows for thee broke deserve not punishment.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: A woman I forswore; but I will prove,

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Thou being a goddess, I forswore not thee:

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: My vow was earthly, thou a heavenly love;

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Thy grace being gain'd cures all disgrace in me.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Vows are but breath, and breath a vapour is:

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Then thou, fair sun, which on my earth dost shine,

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Exhalest this vapour-vow; in thee it is:

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: If broken then, it is no fault of mine:

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: If by me broke, what fool is not so wise

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: To lose an oath to win a paradise?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: This is the liver-vein, which makes flesh a deity,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A green goose a goddess: pure, pure idolatry.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: God amend us, God amend! we are much out o' the way.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: By whom shall I send this?--Company! stay.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Steps aside

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: All hid, all hid; an old infant play.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Like a demigod here sit I in the sky.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And wretched fools' secrets heedfully o'ereye.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: More sacks to the mill! O heavens, I have my wish!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Enter DUMAIN, with a paper

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Dumain transform'd! four woodcocks in a dish!

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: O most divine Kate!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O most profane coxcomb!

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: By heaven, the wonder in a mortal eye!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: By earth, she is not, corporal, there you lie.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Her amber hair for foul hath amber quoted.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: An amber-colour'd raven was well noted.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: As upright as the cedar.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Stoop, I say;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Her shoulder is with child.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: As fair as day.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Ay, as some days; but then no sun must shine.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: O that I had my wish!

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: And I had mine!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And I mine too, good Lord!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Amen, so I had mine: is not that a good word?

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: I would forget her; but a fever she

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Reigns in my blood and will remember'd be.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A fever in your blood! why, then incision

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Would let her out in saucers: sweet misprision!

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Once more I'll read the ode that I have writ.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Once more I'll mark how love can vary wit.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: [Reads]

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: On a day--alack the day!--

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Love, whose month is ever May,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Spied a blossom passing fair

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Playing in the wanton air:

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Through the velvet leaves the wind,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: All unseen, can passage find;

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: That the lover, sick to death,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Wish himself the heaven's breath.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Air, quoth he, thy cheeks may blow;

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Air, would I might triumph so!

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: But, alack, my hand is sworn

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Ne'er to pluck thee from thy thorn;

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Vow, alack, for youth unmeet,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Youth so apt to pluck a sweet!

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Do not call it sin in me,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: That I am forsworn for thee;

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Thou for whom Jove would swear

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Juno but an Ethiope were;

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: And deny himself for Jove,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Turning mortal for thy love.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: This will I send, and something else more plain,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: That shall express my true love's fasting pain.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: O, would the king, Biron, and Longaville,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Were lovers too! Ill, to example ill,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Would from my forehead wipe a perjured note;

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: For none offend where all alike do dote.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: [Advancing]  Dumain, thy love is far from charity.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: You may look pale, but I should blush, I know,

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: To be o'erheard and taken napping so.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: [Advancing]  Come, sir, you blush; as his your case is such;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: You chide at him, offending twice as much;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: You do not love Maria; Longaville

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Did never sonnet for her sake compile,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Nor never lay his wreathed arms athwart

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: His loving bosom to keep down his heart.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I have been closely shrouded in this bush

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And mark'd you both and for you both did blush:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I heard your guilty rhymes, observed your fashion,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Saw sighs reek from you, noted well your passion:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Ay me! says one; O Jove! the other cries;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: One, her hairs were gold, crystal the other's eyes:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: To LONGAVILLE

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: You would for paradise break faith, and troth;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: To DUMAIN

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And Jove, for your love, would infringe an oath.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What will Biron say when that he shall hear

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Faith so infringed, which such zeal did swear?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: How will he scorn! how will he spend his wit!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: How will he triumph, leap and laugh at it!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: For all the wealth that ever I did see,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I would not have him know so much by me.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Now step I forth to whip hypocrisy.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Advancing

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Ah, good my liege, I pray thee, pardon me!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Good heart, what grace hast thou, thus to reprove

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: These worms for loving, that art most in love?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Your eyes do make no coaches; in your tears

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: There is no certain princess that appears;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: You'll not be perjured, 'tis a hateful thing;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Tush, none but minstrels like of sonneting!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: But are you not ashamed? nay, are you not,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: All three of you, to be thus much o'ershot?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: You found his mote; the king your mote did see;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: But I a beam do find in each of three.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, what a scene of foolery have I seen,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Of sighs, of groans, of sorrow and of teen!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O me, with what strict patience have I sat,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To see a king transformed to a gnat!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To see great Hercules whipping a gig,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And profound Solomon to tune a jig,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And Nestor play at push-pin with the boys,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And critic Timon laugh at idle toys!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Where lies thy grief, O, tell me, good Dumain?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And gentle Longaville, where lies thy pain?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And where my liege's? all about the breast:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A caudle, ho!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Too bitter is thy jest.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Are we betray'd thus to thy over-view?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Not you to me, but I betray'd by you:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I, that am honest; I, that hold it sin

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To break the vow I am engaged in;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I am betray'd, by keeping company

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: With men like men of inconstancy.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: When shall you see me write a thing in rhyme?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Or groan for love? or spend a minute's time

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: In pruning me? When shall you hear that I

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Will praise a hand, a foot, a face, an eye,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A gait, a state, a brow, a breast, a waist,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A leg, a limb?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Soft! whither away so fast?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: A true man or a thief that gallops so?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I post from love: good lover, let me go.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Enter JAQUENETTA and COSTARD

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: God bless the king!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What present hast thou there?

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Some certain treason.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What makes treason here?

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Nay, it makes nothing, sir.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: If it mar nothing neither,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The treason and you go in peace away together.

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: I beseech your grace, let this letter be read:

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: Our parson misdoubts it; 'twas treason, he said.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Biron, read it over.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Giving him the paper

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Where hadst thou it?

speaker: JAQUENETTA
text_entry: Of Costard.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Where hadst thou it?

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Of Dun Adramadio, Dun Adramadio.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: BIRON tears the letter

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: How now! what is in you? why dost thou tear it?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A toy, my liege, a toy: your grace needs not fear it.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: It did move him to passion, and therefore let's hear it.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: It is Biron's writing, and here is his name.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Gathering up the pieces

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: [To COSTARD]  Ah, you whoreson loggerhead! you were

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: born to do me shame.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Guilty, my lord, guilty! I confess, I confess.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That you three fools lack'd me fool to make up the mess:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: He, he, and you, and you, my liege, and I,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Are pick-purses in love, and we deserve to die.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, dismiss this audience, and I shall tell you more.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Now the number is even.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: True, true; we are four.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Will these turtles be gone?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Hence, sirs; away!

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Walk aside the true folk, and let the traitors stay.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Exeunt COSTARD and JAQUENETTA

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Sweet lords, sweet lovers, O, let us embrace!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: As true we are as flesh and blood can be:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: The sea will ebb and flow, heaven show his face;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Young blood doth not obey an old decree:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: We cannot cross the cause why we were born;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Therefore of all hands must we be forsworn.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What, did these rent lines show some love of thine?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Did they, quoth you? Who sees the heavenly Rosaline,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That, like a rude and savage man of Inde,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: At the first opening of the gorgeous east,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Bows not his vassal head and strucken blind

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Kisses the base ground with obedient breast?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: What peremptory eagle-sighted eye

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Dares look upon the heaven of her brow,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That is not blinded by her majesty?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What zeal, what fury hath inspired thee now?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: My love, her mistress, is a gracious moon;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: She an attending star, scarce seen a light.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: My eyes are then no eyes, nor I Biron:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, but for my love, day would turn to night!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Of all complexions the cull'd sovereignty

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Do meet, as at a fair, in her fair cheek,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Where several worthies make one dignity,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Where nothing wants that want itself doth seek.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Lend me the flourish of all gentle tongues,--

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Fie, painted rhetoric! O, she needs it not:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To things of sale a seller's praise belongs,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: She passes praise; then praise too short doth blot.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A wither'd hermit, five-score winters worn,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Might shake off fifty, looking in her eye:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Beauty doth varnish age, as if new-born,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And gives the crutch the cradle's infancy:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, 'tis the sun that maketh all things shine.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: By heaven, thy love is black as ebony.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Is ebony like her? O wood divine!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A wife of such wood were felicity.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, who can give an oath? where is a book?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That I may swear beauty doth beauty lack,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: If that she learn not of her eye to look:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: No face is fair that is not full so black.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: O paradox! Black is the badge of hell,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The hue of dungeons and the suit of night;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And beauty's crest becomes the heavens well.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Devils soonest tempt, resembling spirits of light.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, if in black my lady's brows be deck'd,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: It mourns that painting and usurping hair

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Should ravish doters with a false aspect;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And therefore is she born to make black fair.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Her favour turns the fashion of the days,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For native blood is counted painting now;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And therefore red, that would avoid dispraise,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Paints itself black, to imitate her brow.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: To look like her are chimney-sweepers black.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: And since her time are colliers counted bright.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And Ethiopes of their sweet complexion crack.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Dark needs no candles now, for dark is light.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Your mistresses dare never come in rain,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For fear their colours should be wash'd away.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: 'Twere good, yours did; for, sir, to tell you plain,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I'll find a fairer face not wash'd to-day.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I'll prove her fair, or talk till doomsday here.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: No devil will fright thee then so much as she.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: I never knew man hold vile stuff so dear.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Look, here's thy love: my foot and her face see.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, if the streets were paved with thine eyes,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Her feet were much too dainty for such tread!

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: O, vile! then, as she goes, what upward lies

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: The street should see as she walk'd overhead.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: But what of this? are we not all in love?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Nothing so sure; and thereby all forsworn.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Then leave this chat; and, good Biron, now prove

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Our loving lawful, and our faith not torn.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Ay, marry, there; some flattery for this evil.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: O, some authority how to proceed;

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Some tricks, some quillets, how to cheat the devil.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Some salve for perjury.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: 'Tis more than need.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Have at you, then, affection's men at arms.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Consider what you first did swear unto,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To fast, to study, and to see no woman;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Flat treason 'gainst the kingly state of youth.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Say, can you fast? your stomachs are too young;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And abstinence engenders maladies.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And where that you have vow'd to study, lords,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: In that each of you have forsworn his book,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Can you still dream and pore and thereon look?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For when would you, my lord, or you, or you,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Have found the ground of study's excellence

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Without the beauty of a woman's face?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: From women's eyes this doctrine I derive;  They are the ground, the books, the academes From whence doth spring the true Promethean fire

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Why, universal plodding poisons up

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: The nimble spirits in the arteries,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: As motion and long-during action tires

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: The sinewy vigour of the traveller.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Now, for not looking on a woman's face,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: You have in that forsworn the use of eyes

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And study too, the causer of your vow;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For where is any author in the world

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Teaches such beauty as a woman's eye?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Learning is but an adjunct to ourself

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And where we are our learning likewise is:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Then when ourselves we see in ladies' eyes,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Do we not likewise see our learning there?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, we have made a vow to study, lords,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And in that vow we have forsworn our books.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For when would you, my liege, or you, or you,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: In leaden contemplation have found out

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Such fiery numbers as the prompting eyes

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Of beauty's tutors have enrich'd you with?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Other slow arts entirely keep the brain;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And therefore, finding barren practisers,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Scarce show a harvest of their heavy toil:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: But love, first learned in a lady's eyes,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Lives not alone immured in the brain;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: But, with the motion of all elements,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Courses as swift as thought in every power,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And gives to every power a double power,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Above their functions and their offices.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: It adds a precious seeing to the eye;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A lover's eyes will gaze an eagle blind;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A lover's ear will hear the lowest sound,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: When the suspicious head of theft is stopp'd:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Love's feeling is more soft and sensible

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Than are the tender horns of cockl'd snails;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Love's tongue proves dainty Bacchus gross in taste:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For valour, is not Love a Hercules,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Still climbing trees in the Hesperides?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Subtle as Sphinx; as sweet and musical

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: As bright Apollo's lute, strung with his hair:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And when Love speaks, the voice of all the gods

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Makes heaven drowsy with the harmony.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Never durst poet touch a pen to write

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Until his ink were temper'd with Love's sighs;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, then his lines would ravish savage ears

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And plant in tyrants mild humility.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: From women's eyes this doctrine I derive:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: They sparkle still the right Promethean fire;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: They are the books, the arts, the academes,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That show, contain and nourish all the world:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Else none at all in ought proves excellent.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Then fools you were these women to forswear,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Or keeping what is sworn, you will prove fools.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For wisdom's sake, a word that all men love,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Or for love's sake, a word that loves all men,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Or for men's sake, the authors of these women,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Or women's sake, by whom we men are men,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Let us once lose our oaths to find ourselves,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Or else we lose ourselves to keep our oaths.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: It is religion to be thus forsworn,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For charity itself fulfills the law,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And who can sever love from charity?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Saint Cupid, then! and, soldiers, to the field!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Advance your standards, and upon them, lords;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Pell-mell, down with them! but be first advised,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: In conflict that you get the sun of them.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Now to plain-dealing; lay these glozes by:

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Shall we resolve to woo these girls of France?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And win them too: therefore let us devise

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Some entertainment for them in their tents.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: First, from the park let us conduct them thither;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Then homeward every man attach the hand

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Of his fair mistress: in the afternoon

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: We will with some strange pastime solace them,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Such as the shortness of the time can shape;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For revels, dances, masks and merry hours

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Forerun fair Love, strewing her way with flowers.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Away, away! no time shall be omitted

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: That will betime, and may by us be fitted.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Allons! allons! Sow'd cockle reap'd no corn;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And justice always whirls in equal measure:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Light wenches may prove plagues to men forsworn;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: If so, our copper buys no better treasure.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: LOVE'S LABOURS LOST
